body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner would respectfully state, that a Judgment for Fifty Dollars and Costs was rendered against him in the Lexington City Court on the 29th day of May last for Carrying a Concealed and deadly weapon, and respectfully solicits a remission of said fine.

I was the atty for the City of Lexington, at the time the foregoing fine was imposed. The Jury under the Law from the Court, was compelled to return a verdict of "guilty." During the present troubles, it is ^of^ a class of cases, that presents grounds for Executive clemency, in my opinion.

Lexington City Ct
Pttn granted fine remitted 26 Decr 1862
J F Robinson

$50 } Weapons.
Clayton Wood
Issd Decr 31. 1862
C. Wood
